intro: Cyanopsis microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight bluish tinge, contributing to its ornamental value. Cyanopsis microcephala is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
